    • Constructor Detail

      • Bishop

        public Bishop​(java.lang.String owner,
              int x,
              int y)
        A bishop is a chess piece on the chess board. It moves in a diagonal line and will be placed on the board at proper places. The object bishop is displayed as white or black as strings "wB" or "bB" and has various attributes to it from ChessPiece.java.
        Parameters:
        owner - sets the player to be the owner
        x - the row number of the piece, in chess terms, it is numbers 1 to 8
        y - the column number of the piece, in chess terms, it is letters a to h
        See Also:
        ChessPiece

    • Method Detail

      • print

        public void print()
        Prints piece to console. Consists of "wB" or "bB" strings to indicate white and black bishops on the board, respectively.
        Specified by:
        print in class ChessPiece
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        ChessPiece()

      • isLegal

        public boolean isLegal​(ChessPiece[][] board,
                       int x,
                       int y)
        Method that implements isLegal and checks the legality of a move, specifically for a bishop. There are many conditions that need to be fulfilled in order for the move to be declared legal. The spaces in between the destination and starting space need to be checked for pieces in between, otherwise be declared illegal.

        These factors include:

        • Cannot take your own piece
        • Check if the movement of the bishop is in a diagonal line
        • If only moving one, already checked if player piece is at destination, so assume true
        • Check if there are any pieces in between when moving diagonal (south east)
        • Check if there are any pieces in between when moving diagonal (south west)
        • Check if there are any pieces in between when moving diagonal (north east)
        • Check if there are any pieces in between when moving diagonal (north west)
        • If no pieces are in between, move is successful
          Specified by:
          isLegal in class ChessPiece
          Parameters:
          board - the 8x8 chess board created for pieces to be placed on and chess to be played
          x - the row number of the piece, in chess terms, it is numbers 1 to 8
          y - the column number of the piece, in chess terms, it is letters a to h
          Returns:
          See Also:
          ChessPiece.isLegal(ChessPiece[][], int, int)

        • attacking

          public ChessPiece[][] attacking​(ChessPiece[][] board)
          Checks if the bishop is attacking the enemy king, thus creating check for the other player.

          This includes:

            Parses through all spaces south east and sets them to attacked until meeting a player or enemy piece Parses through all spaces south west and sets them to attacked until meeting a player or enemy piece Parses through all spaces north east and sets them to attacked until meeting a player or enemy piece Parses through all spaces north west and sets them to attacked until meeting a player or enemy piece
            Specified by:
            attacking in class ChessPiece
            Returns:
            board
